perturbation.original_text:
7.	REPRESENTATIONS, WARRANTIES AND INDEMNITY

a.	Talent represents and warrants that he has not granted nor will he grant to any other party any right, permission, or license to use the Property in connection with the advertisement, sale, or promotion of the Product or in connection with products that are identical or substantially similar to the Product.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.	REPRESENTATIONS, WARRANTIES AND INDEMNITY

a.	Talent represents and warrants that he may grant to other parties rights, permissions, or licenses to use the Property in connection with the advertisement, sale, or promotion of products similar to the Product, at Talent's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction as the original states Talent will not grant rights to others for similar products, while the modified text states Talent may grant such rights, creating uncertainty regarding Talent's exclusivity.

perturbation.original_text:
3.	TERM

This Agreement shall be effective as of the date of execution by both parties. The period of license granted shall be for the Term and shall extend for a period of twenty four (24) months or until terminated as per clause 8 herein. It is agreed that the Term may be extended upon mutual agreement between the parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.	TERM

This Agreement shall be effective as of the date of execution by both parties. The period of license granted shall be for the Term and shall extend for a period of twelve (12) months or until terminated at any time by the Company. It is agreed that any extension of the Term is solely at the Companyâ€™s discretion, without needing mutual agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a 24-month term with extension upon mutual agreement. The modified text shortens the term to 12 months and gives the Company the unilateral right to terminate and extend the term, creating a contradiction about the duration and terms of extension.

perturbation.original_text:
5.	REVIEW OF MATERIALS

a.	Talent shall have the right of approval in respect of all Product being proposed as any part of the Property appearing or integrated into it and all proposed use of the Property (including to whom the Property is distributed for sale if other than the general public) prior to public release and distribution.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.	REVIEW OF MATERIALS

a.	Talent shall have the right to provide comments on all Product being proposed as any part of the Property appearing or integrated into it; however, final approval for all proposed use of the Property rests with the Company, and the company has no obligation to consider these comments. The Company's decision will be binding.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants Talent the right of approval over materials. The modified text reduces this to merely providing comments, with the Company having final and binding approval, contradicting Talent's initial approval right and creating uncertainty about the level of control Talent has.
